Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing

Class ExpandingRegionIndexingTree<T>

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.AbstractIndexingTree<T,​fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.RegionIndexingNode<T>>
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.RegionIndexingTree<T>
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.ExpandingRegionIndexingTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects indexed
All Implemented Interfaces:
IndexingTree<T,​fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.RegionIndexingNode<T>>, Dimensioned, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Sizeable
public class ExpandingRegionIndexingTree<T> extends RegionIndexingTree<T>

A region-based k-d tree where the size of the initial region is unknown.

The root node region size (which must contain all the points of the tree) is worked out from the points inserted in the tree. A smart algorithm by Paavo Toivanen) enables the tree to grow 'upwards' by enlarging the root node region (and consequently re-rooting the tree) as required to enclose the newly arriving points.

NOTE: a possibly strong restriction of this implementation is that the indexed space must have the same length in all dimensions, i.e. it is a hypercube. This is the best assumption we can do without additional information. Use BoundedRegionIndexingTree if you need to relax this assumption in your particular application.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 10-09-2018
